discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Partner super users can get insights into the records of other partner users who are at their role level or below them in the account role hierarchy. Super users can access records according to their level of permissions. For example, if a manager with full access to cases is granted Super User Access, then they can view and edit cases of other managers and their direct reports. A different manager who has read-only access to cases can only view the cases of other managers and their direct reports, even as a Super User.

What could be the cause of the error?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The cause of the error when Sales attempts to merge the accounts could be:

B. Accounts used in an External Account Hierarchy cannot be merged with another account.

In Salesforce, accounts that are part of an External Account Hierarchy cannot be merged with another account. Since Universal Containers (UC) uses the External Account Hierarchy to assist with data access for its biggest customers, such as Cloud Kicks, attempting to merge accounts within this hierarchy would result in an error. This limitation ensures data integrity and security within the hierarchy structure.
